intro: Oestlundorchis rhombilabia, commonly known as the rhombic-labial orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in a spike, typically blooming in late summer. Oestlundorchis rhombilabia is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is adapted to grow in grassland and rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
